dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A recent KPMG study on digital innovation has really ruffled some feathers in the business world.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A recent K P M G study on digital innovation has really ruffled some feathers in the business world.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Mikhail Lomtadze, the CEO of a rival company, did not hold back at all. He called it a PR stunt for Deloitte.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Mikhail Lomtadze, the C E O of a rival company, did not hold back at all. He called it a P R stunt for Deloitte.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he mentioned that the survey was only completed by what, like, 15 executives? That's such a tiny sample size.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he mentioned that the survey was only completed by what, like, fifteen executives? That's such a tiny sample size.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The survey was completed by 71 CEOs from the largest Kazakhstani companies across various sectors of the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he pointed out they were mostly from tech startups, which is a pretty specific group. It's not exactly representative of the whole market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he pointed out they were mostly from tech startups, which is a pretty specific group. It's not exactly representative of the whole market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The survey was completed by 71 CEOs from the largest Kazakhstani companies across various sectors of the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then he went in on Deloitte, saying their team worked overtime to launch, um, antiquated services. That's just brutal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then he went in on Deloitte, saying their team worked overtime to launch, um, antiquated services. That's just brutal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is an award for the entire Kaspi.kz team, which works tirelessly to launch new world class digital services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. He's basically accusing them of being behind the times while pretending to be innovative. And then he brought up Kaspi.kz, saying the survey criticized their lack of adaptability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. He's basically accusing them of being behind the times while pretending to be innovative. And then he brought up the website, saying the survey criticized their lack of adaptability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions, the prompt introduction of new, modern services and a high level of consumer confidence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is interesting because he's admitting they're falling short, but then questioning the validity of the study itself. It's like a double-edged complaint.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is interesting because he's admitting they're falling short, but then questioning the validity of the study itself. It's like a double-edged complaint.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And he mentioned that the full study is on Deloitte's website, which kind of implies it's not an independent thing, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And he mentioned that the full study is on Deloitte's website, which kind of implies it's not an independent thing, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The full version of the study can be found on the PwC website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And the fact that KPMG has only done this research globally for five years… that does make you wonder about the depth of the data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And the fact that K P M G has only done this research globally for five years... that does make you wonder about the depth of the data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting this research around the world for 25 years and for the last 10 years in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's still relatively new. But the overall focus was on the decline of digital innovation, which is a huge topic right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's still relatively new. But the overall focus was on the decline of digital innovation, which is a huge topic right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And Lomtadze's response is just so sarcastic—congratulating them on the PR stunt? Ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And Lomtadze's response is just so sarcastic-congratulating them on the P R stunt? Ouch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, you can feel the frustration. He's saying customers are paying the price for this perceived incompetence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, you can feel the frustration. He's saying customers are paying the price for this perceived incompetence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to every valued customer for being with us. We will never let you down!.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a bold move to publicly call out a rival and a big firm like KPMG in one go.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a bold move to publicly call out a rival and a big firm like K P M G in one go.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Makes you think about how these industry reports can really shape perceptions, for better or worse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Makes you think about how these industry reports can really shape perceptions, for better or worse.

artist_script:
A recent KPMG study on digital innovation has really ruffled some feathers in the business world.
HostB: Oh, absolutely. Mikhail Lomtadze, the CEO of a rival company, did not hold back at all. He called it a PR stunt for Deloitte.
HostA: Yeah, and he mentioned that the survey was only completed by what, like, 15 executives? That's such a tiny sample size.
HostB: Right, and he pointed out they were mostly from tech startups, which is a pretty specific group. It’s not exactly representative of the whole market.
HostA: And then he went in on Deloitte, saying their team worked overtime to launch, um, antiquated services. That's just brutal.
HostB: Totally. He’s basically accusing them of being behind the times while pretending to be innovative. And then he brought up Kaspi.kz, saying the survey criticized their lack of adaptability.
HostA: Which is interesting because he’s admitting they’re falling short, but then questioning the validity of the study itself. It’s like a double-edged complaint.
HostB: Exactly. And he mentioned that the full study is on Deloitte's website, which kind of implies it’s not an independent thing, you know?
HostA: For sure. And the fact that KPMG has only done this research globally for five years… that does make you wonder about the depth of the data.
HostB: Yeah, it’s still relatively new. But the overall focus was on the decline of digital innovation, which is a huge topic right now.
HostA: Definitely. And Lomtadze’s response is just so sarcastic—congratulating them on the PR stunt? Ouch.
HostB: I mean, you can feel the frustration. He’s saying customers are paying the price for this perceived incompetence.
HostA: It’s a bold move to publicly call out a rival and a big firm like KPMG in one go.
HostB: Absolutely. Makes you think about how these industry reports can really shape perceptions, for better or worse.
